text: Émile Idée (19 July 1920 - 30 December 2024) was a French professional road bicycle racer. He was born in Nouvion-le-Comte, France. UNE PLÉIADE DE CHAMPIONS Avec Émile Idée, 92 ans, en tête! 25/06/2012Émile Idée, bon pied bon oeil ! Publié le 26/06/2012 "A bientôt 92 ans, le Picard s'est vu récompensé par la médaille d'honneur que lui a remis David Lappartient, Président de la Fédération Française de Cyclisme." Idée was a five-time winner of the Critérium International, a record shared with Raymond Poulidor and Jens Voigt. He finished in second place in the 1948 Paris–Roubaix. Idée turned 100 in July 2020. He died on 30 December 2024 in Marolles-en-Brie, France at the age of 104. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official Tour de France results for Emile Idée Category:1920 births Category:2024 deaths Category:French cyclists Category:People from Aisne Category:Sportspeople from Hauts-de-France Category:French centenarians
title: Émile Idée
